messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Rehearsal: Was  Peaceful Parenting  (was "sigh")
messages.msgSnippet: ... I had a performance tonight (Saturday) with my group GaiaWolf.  It s more of a mixed bag of genres from world music to R&B to reggae to contemporary
messages.messageBody:
At 13:36 10/26/02 -0700, you wrote:

> > I was driving home from a rehearsal tonight and listening to that
> > particular tape.
>
>Gee, I was driving home from a rehearsal that night as well. <g> Mine was
>for an orchestra concert. I've got two concerts this week, one last night
>and one tonight. (Different orchestras) What was yours?
>Tia

I had a performance tonight (Saturday) with my group GaiaWolf. It's more
of a mixed bag of genres from world music to R&B to reggae to contemporary
acoustic. GaiaWolf's mission has to do with promoting universal harmony
amongst species, so to that end we sing about wolves in Yellowstone, how
drought in the Serengeti affects the elephants who live there, peace, the
manatee, pilot whales, starting over, what the Statue of Liberty might say
if she could talk and tell us what she's been seeing, and on and on. If
you'd like to hear some of the music we do, you can listen for free at this
website: http://artists.mp3s.com/artists/192/ec_lorick__gaiawolf.html My
most favorite tune on there is Abby, Stay.

What's your instrument, Tia? Do you perform often?

Marji


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
> I was driving home from a rehearsal tonight and listening to that
> particular tape.

Gee, I was driving home from a rehearsal that night as well. <g> Mine was
for an orchestra concert. I've got two concerts this week, one last night
and one tonight. (Different orchestras) What was yours?
Tia
